page.title: 17Mr Ben Jones continued
page.content: Mr Jones remembers children's poverty being measured by the degree of protrusion of their ribs. The picture of undernourished children queueing for a spoonfull of cod-liver oil still haunts him.Clearly the miners and their families were sustained by the degree of community spirit. Valley children had little educational oppertunity at the turn of the century. However the miners sought to improve their own knowledge, and burning with a fierce determination that their childrens should know a better life, opened institutes, libraries, clubs, societies supported with voluntary contributions from their pay(1 penny per week) Two World Wars, women earning the second income in munitions factories changed the life of the village.
